definitions.text: a share of the profits
examples: everyone got a cut of the earnings

definitions.text: (film) an immediate transition from one shot to the next
examples: the cut from the accident scene to the hospital seemed too abrupt

definitions.text: a trench resembling a furrow that was made by erosion or excavation
a step on some scale
examples: he is a cut above the rest

definitions.text: a wound made by cutting
examples: he put a bandage over the cut

definitions.text: a piece of meat that has been cut from an animal carcass
a remark capable of wounding mentally
a distinct selection of music from a recording or a compact disc
examples: he played the first cut on the cd
the title track of the album

definitions.text: the omission that is made when an editorial change shortens a written passage
examples: an editor's deletions frequently upset young authors
both parties agreed on the excision of the proposed clause

definitions.text: the style in which a garment is cut
a canal made by erosion or excavation
a refusal to recognize someone you know
in baseball; a batter's attempt to hit a pitched ball
examples: he took a vicious cut at the ball

definitions.text: (sports) a stroke that puts reverse spin on the ball
examples: cuts do not bother a good tennis player

definitions.text: the division of a deck of cards before dealing
examples: he insisted that we give him the last cut before every deal
the cutting of the cards soon became a ritual

definitions.text: the act of penetrating or opening open with a sharp edge
examples: his cut in the lining revealed the hidden jewels

definitions.text: the act of cutting something into parts
examples: his cutting of the cake made a terrible mess

definitions.text: the act of shortening something by chopping off the ends
examples: the barber gave him a good cut

definitions.text: the act of reducing the amount or number
examples: the mayor proposed extensive cuts in the city budget

definitions.text: an unexcused absence from class
examples: he was punished for taking too many cuts in his math class

definitions.text: separate with or as if with an instrument
cut down on; make a reduction in
examples: The employer wants to cut back health benefits

definitions.text: turn sharply; change direction abruptly
examples: The car cut to the left at the intersection
The motorbike veered to the right

definitions.text: make an incision or separation
discharge from a group
examples: The coach cut two players from the team

definitions.text: form by probing, penetrating, or digging
examples: The sweat cut little rivulets into her face

definitions.text: style and tailor in a certain fashion
hit (a ball) with a spin so that it turns in the opposite direction
make out and issue
examples: Please make the check out to me

definitions.text: cut and assemble the components of
intentionally fail to attend
be able to manage or manage successfully
examples: she could not cut the long days in the office

definitions.text: give the appearance or impression of
move (one's fist)
examples: his opponent cut upward toward his chin

definitions.text: pass directly and often in haste
examples: We cut through the neighbor's yard to get home sooner

definitions.text: pass through or across
make an abrupt change of image or sound
examples: cut from one scene to another

definitions.text: stop filming
make a recording of
examples: She cut all of her major titles again

definitions.text: record a performance on (a medium)
create by duplicating data
form or shape by cutting or incising
perform or carry out
function as a cutting instrument
allow incision or separation
divide a deck of cards at random into two parts to make selection difficult
examples: She cut the deck for a long time

definitions.text: cause to stop operating by disengaging a switch
reap or harvest
fell by sawing; hew
examples: The Vietnamese cut a lot of timber while they occupied Cambodia

definitions.text: penetrate injuriously
examples: The glass from the shattered windshield cut into her forehead

definitions.text: refuse to acknowledge
examples: She cut him dead at the meeting

definitions.text: shorten as if by severing the edges or ends of
weed out unwanted or unnecessary things
examples: We had to lose weight, so we cut the sugar from our diet

definitions.text: dissolve by breaking down the fat of
have a reducing effect
cease, stop
examples: We had to cut short the conversation

definitions.text: reduce in scope while retaining essential elements
lessen the strength or flavor of a solution or mixture
have grow through the gums
grow through the gums
cut off the testicles (of male animals such as horses)
examples: the vet gelded the young horse

definitions.text: separated into parts or laid open or penetrated with a sharp edge or instrument
fashioned or shaped by cutting
with parts removed
made neat and tidy by trimming
(used of grass or vegetation) cut down with a hand implement or machine
examples: the smell of newly mown hay

definitions.text: (of pages of a book) having the folds of the leaves trimmed or slit
examples: the cut pages of the book

definitions.text: (of a male animal) having the testicles removed
(used of rates or prices) reduced usually sharply
mixed with water
